content: row 20 repeat row 19 63 row 21 repeat row 19 59 row 22 repeat row 19 55 if you plan on using a ribbon for your tie continue to row 23 if you d like to make a crochet tie skip to optional crochet tie ending row row 23 slip_stitch down the side angle to the top of the pocket turn chain 1 single_crochet in the sl sts you just made and in each st across the top then down the angle on the side slip_stitch to top of the pocket to join weave in ends cut a piece of ribbon about 5 ft long weave this in and out of the last row of hdcs i like to tie a little knot at the edge of the apron so the top doesn t cinch and boink your eggs around optional crochet tie ending row slip_stitch down the side angle to the top of the pocket turn chain 1 single_crochet in the sl sts you just made then stop chain 80 or to 20 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each chain you just made single_crochet in each st across the top and stop chain 80 or to 20 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook and each chain you just made then down the angle on the side slip_stitch to top of the pocket to join cut yarn and weave in your ends this picture shows round 2 after your turn you will now begin to work the double_crochet into what were the back loops these are now considered your front loops as they are facing you
